resources.string: Allow Sensors permission to apps by default
Sensors is a non-standard permission, apps may malfunction if it’s denied.
A permission prompt will be shown when an app tries to access sensors. Note that some apps may need to be manually restarted after allowing the Sensors permission.
Allow camera access when the device is locked
Automatically reboot the device if it hasn\'t been unlocked within the selected duration of time.
Enables adding a timestamp to screenshot EXIF metadata
A-GNSS (assisted satellite geolocation) based on nearby cell towers.
Will make acquiring location lock significantly slower, especially if PSDS is disabled too
Device restart is required to disable this setting.
Device restart is required to allow enabling this setting.
Special access to hardware accelerators for Google apps
Grant special access to hardware accelerators to Google apps

"Some Google apps expect to be able to access hardware accelerators in a special, more capable way than regular apps do.
Examples of such apps: • Google Camera • Google Photos • Google Recorder
This setting applies to all users on the device."

"If PSDS is enabled, static PSDS information files will be downloaded periodically to improve location resolution speed and accuracy. No query or data is sent to the server. These files contain orbits and statuses of satellites, Earth environmental data and time adjustment information."
Will make acquiring location lock significantly slower, especially if SUPL is disabled too

"Connectivity check is a special empty server request that is made to find out whether the current network has internet connection. There are HTTP, HTTPS, DNS, DNS-over-TLS and DNS-over-HTTPS connectivity checks.
If Wi-Fi is disconnected, it will be turned off after the selected timeout.
"If there are no connected devices, Bluetooth will turn off after the selected timeout."
This feature exists to reduce attack surface, especially for a locked device.
Allow new USB peripherals when unlocked
Launch apps in a more secure way than Android which takes slightly longer and increases memory usage by app processes.

"Native code debugging (ptrace) is needed for generating useful logs from crashes and for debugging native code. This feature slightly weakens the app sandbox. Disabling native debugging might break some apps, most notably banking apps.
Enable app installs and updates from first party sources only
